page.title: 09POPULATION TRENDS
page.content: In 1851 the population of the parishes of Penpont and Thornhill was 3863. By 1971 this had fallen to 2453. Factors contributing to this are:- 1)Fewer farm labourers have been required as machinery has been introduced and farms have specialised more in pastoral rather than arable production. 2)Fewer farmers now work the land as farms have been amalgamated into larger units. 3)Fewer craftsmen find employment in the villages with the tendancy to use mass produced imported articles. 4)Many shops, trades, schools and churches have closed causing more unemployment. The falling birth rate will cause further population loss, The local school's roll of 426 will fall to 344 by 1991.
